bibl.title: Letter from Theodore C. Lyster to Henry Rose Carter, July 16, 1924

div1.p: Lyster writes that he glad to hear Carter's health has improved. He discusses the origins of yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Theodore C. Lyster to Henry Rose Carter, July 16, 1924
div1.opener:
Book
Lyster
THEODORE C. LYSTER, M. D.
EUGENE R. LEWIS, M. D.
ISAAC H. JONES, M. D.
SAMUEL D. INGHAM, M. D.
1920 WILSHIRE BOULEVARD
LOS ANGELES
7-16-24.
Dear Dr. Carter,
div1.p:
Your letter gave me much
pleasure. First that you really want my
opinion and second that there is a chance
to discuss yellow fever. Before all however
is the good news that you are in good
shape. Better come out here for the winter
or go South. Why take chances when not
necessary. You are far too valuable to
be allowed to leave us for lack of taking
ordinary preventive measures. Laura-
2.
THEODORE C. LYSTER, M. D.
EUGENE R. LEWIS, M. D.
ISAAC H. JONES, M. D.
SAMUEL D. INGHAM, M. D.
1920 WILSHIRE BOULEVARD
LOS ANGELES
I know agrees with me. how about
the work. Please let me see
all and give me a treat. As for the
origin I am open to argument. Mrs. Mitchell
was here but is now in San Francisco.
She has been doing her best to get data
from early Aztec literature but nothing
convincing so far. My thought that in early
wars between those in Yucatan (Mayan) and
those of the highlands (Aztec) every chance
should have been offered for infection
if the disease was present. Smallpox
was a common notation - only after
the arrival however of the Spaniards.
3.
THEODORE C. LYSTER, M. D.
EUGENE R. LEWIS, M. D.
ISAAC H. JONES, M. D.
SAMUEL D. INGHAM, M. D.
1920 WILSHIRE BOULEVARD
LOS ANGELES
I will get in touch again with Mrs.
Mitchell for more recent developments.

Will read all your write with
pleasure but my comments are hardly
worthy of serious mention.

Was glad to get Noguchi's recent
reprints also one by Connor.

Best regards from all the Lysters to
you and Laura.

Our small son Ted is in a summer camp.
Our big boy is here with us - ill. Picked up an
pyelo-nefritis (Hypher Barillans) and is
keeping us anxious. Had to stop school.
We are worried but are told he will come
through all right. Lia and I are well.
